review_title: Work here only if you want to make a difference to the world and want to grow ptofessionally
pros:
Fair to employee - Employer gives me time-off or overtime whenever people work over.  They also ask staff to come in late in the next day to make up the overwork hour.  I can tell they do things diligently according to the labor law.

Felt being valued and recognized good works - President and CEO is often to acknowledges staff who did good work in their scope or show committed leadership in staff meeting or team huddle, no matter they are junior staff or at director level.  
The top management encourages staff to take lunch break and leave work on time unless it's in the busiest fundraising season. Discourage people to work at lunch or overload themselves.    
   
Family comes first - employer is very understanding and accommodating to staff's family needs.  Whenever we need to take couple hours or take time off for family/child needs, as long as it is reasonable, they are  willing to accommodate and give permission. 

Focused and goal-driven - No non-sense in this organization.  

Live up to the core values of the organization  

Professional development for each staff in annual basis

Donor's interests come first - show integrity in the decisions they made and the way they do business.
cons:
Shortage of staff - A lot to handle and to achieve in this organization but not enough human resources to handle the foreseeable business expansion

high turnaround - not easy to find the right fit for the organization who have shared values and good work ethics

Work office is crowded - work spaces are separated by partitions or a small room with 3 to 4 work desks. 

Communications - top-down or upward communications is not enough, room to improve.
